channel.title: Boxing Ring
channel.description: Why can't I spawn a boxing ring on my 667?

item.title: Boxing Ring
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,645738.0.html
^I wrote that a while back for a 317 renamed client, with some work I’m sure you can rewrite it for your client.

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing Ring
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:538252”][quote author=masan05 link=topic=657080.msg4396072#msg4396072 date=1389149783]

Yes, the -1 is the rotation.

I don’t know how to explain the rotation very well, but I’ll give it a go:
Every model has a “default” position. This position would be 0. The face (the front of the object) will not always be facing the same as other objects that are also set to 0.
I believe going negative in numbers will rotate your object right, and positive left. I didn’t actually look into the “mechanics” behind this and if you want to understand it better the code in your server will do so.

Thanks. I got that, now one last piece, what are the ids for the strings that go around the mat, I can’t find them…
[/quote]
Have fun finding those. As I personally don’t know. If you can’t find them anywhere, try dumping the object ids/names from your client. And if that still doesn’t work, it’s probably a configuration for some reason.[/quote]
Thanks! Ill try that, but if someone can post the ids or an easier way, just post below. I will try this though.

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing Ring
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“masan05, post:12, topic:538252”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=657080.msg4396063#msg4396063 date=1389147790]
Yes, the -1 is the rotation.

I don’t know how to explain the rotation very well, but I’ll give it a go:
Every model has a “default” position. This position would be 0. The face (the front of the object) will not always be facing the same as other objects that are also set to 0.
I believe going negative in numbers will rotate your object right, and positive left. I didn’t actually look into the “mechanics” behind this and if you want to understand it better the code in your server will do so.
[/quote]
Thanks. I got that, now one last piece, what are the ids for the strings that go around the mat, I can’t find them…[/quote]
Have fun finding those. As I personally don’t know. If you can’t find them anywhere, try dumping the object ids/names from your client. And if that still doesn’t work, it’s probably a configuration for some reason.

Read full topic

Yes, the -1 is the rotation.

I don’t know how to explain the rotation very well, but I’ll give it a go:
Every model has a “default” position. This position would be 0. The face (the front of the object) will not always be facing the same as other objects that are also set to 0.
I believe going negative in numbers will rotate your object right, and positive left. I didn’t actually look into the “mechanics” behind this and if you want to understand it better the code in your server will do so.

item.title: Boxing Ring
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:538252”]I forget who I got this from but here’s some object types:

0 - straight walls, fences etc 1 - diagonal walls corner, fences etc connectors 2 - entire walls, fences etc corners 3 - straight wall corners, fences etc connectors 4 - straight inside wall decoration 5 - straight outside wall decoration 6 - diagonal outside wall decoration 7 - diagonal inside wall decoration 8 - diagonal in wall decoration 9 - diagonal walls, fences etc 10 - all kinds of objects, trees, statues, signs, fountains etc etc 11 - ground objects like daisies etc 12 - straight sloped roofs 13 - diagonal sloped roofs 14 - diagonal slope connecting roofs 15 - straight sloped corner connecting roofs 16 - straight sloped corner roof 17 - straight flat top roofs 18 - straight bottom egde roofs 19 - diagonal bottom edge connecting roofs 20 - straight bottom edge connecting roofs 21 - straight bottom edge connecting corner roofs 22 - ground decoration + map signs (quests, water fountains, shops etc)[/quote]

[quote=“DAn0194, post:8, topic:538252”][quote author=masan05 link=topic=657080.msg4396019#msg4396019 date=1389140733]

Umm post your object spawn method and I can show you.

The command:

if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("object") && (player.getRights() == 7)) { try { World.spawnObject( new WorldObject(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]), 10, -1, player.getX(), player.getY(), player .getPlane()), true); } catch (NumberFormatException e) { player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage("Use: setkills id"); } return true; }

The World (SpawnObject) method:

public static final void spawnObject(WorldObject object, boolean clip) { int regionId = object.getRegionId(); getRegion(regionId).addObject(object); if (clip) { int baseLocalX = object.getX() - ((regionId >> 8) * 64); int baseLocalY = object.getY() - ((regionId & 0xff) * 64); getRegion(regionId).addMapObject(object, baseLocalX, baseLocalY); } synchronized (players) { for (Player p2 : players) { if (p2 == null || !p2.hasStarted() || p2.hasFinished() || !p2.getMapRegionsIds().contains(regionId)) continue; p2.getPackets().sendSpawnedObject(object); } } }
[/quote]
new WorldObject(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]), 10, -1, player.getX(), player.getY(), player.getPlane()), true);

You see the green 10 try changing that around and see if it does anything.[/quote]

Thanks guys. I got it before the list but thank you for releasing that.
Also, what is the -1? the rotation right?

------------------------EDIT---------------------------
Actually i got it, except the strings around the whole thing, what are the ids for those? cant find them.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I forget who I got this from but here’s some object types:

0 - straight walls, fences etc 1 - diagonal walls corner, fences etc connectors 2 - entire walls, fences etc corners 3 - straight wall corners, fences etc connectors 4 - straight inside wall decoration 5 - straight outside wall decoration 6 - diagonal outside wall decoration 7 - diagonal inside wall decoration 8 - diagonal in wall decoration 9 - diagonal walls, fences etc 10 - all kinds of objects, trees, statues, signs, fountains etc etc 11 - ground objects like daisies etc 12 - straight sloped roofs 13 - diagonal sloped roofs 14 - diagonal slope connecting roofs 15 - straight sloped corner connecting roofs 16 - straight sloped corner roof 17 - straight flat top roofs 18 - straight bottom egde roofs 19 - diagonal bottom edge connecting roofs 20 - straight bottom edge connecting roofs 21 - straight bottom edge connecting corner roofs 22 - ground decoration + map signs (quests, water fountains, shops etc)

Read full topic

Umm post your object spawn method and I can show you.

The command:

if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("object") && (player.getRights() == 7)) { try { World.spawnObject( new WorldObject(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]), 10, -1, player.getX(), player.getY(), player .getPlane()), true); } catch (NumberFormatException e) { player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage("Use: setkills id"); } return true; }

The World (SpawnObject) method:

public static final void spawnObject(WorldObject object, boolean clip) { int regionId = object.getRegionId(); getRegion(regionId).addObject(object); if (clip) { int baseLocalX = object.getX() - ((regionId >> 8) * 64); int baseLocalY = object.getY() - ((regionId & 0xff) * 64); getRegion(regionId).addMapObject(object, baseLocalX, baseLocalY); } synchronized (players) { for (Player p2 : players) { if (p2 == null || !p2.hasStarted() || p2.hasFinished() || !p2.getMapRegionsIds().contains(regionId)) continue; p2.getPackets().sendSpawnedObject(object); } } }[/quote]
new WorldObject(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]), 10, -1, player.getX(), player.getY(), player.getPlane()), true);

You see the green 10 try changing that around and see if it does anything.

Read full topic

@masan05 wrote:

DAn0194:

Umm post your object spawn method and I can show you.

The command:

if (cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("object") && (player.getRights() == 7)) { try { World.spawnObject( new WorldObject(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]), 10, -1, player.getX(), player.getY(), player .getPlane()), true); } catch (NumberFormatException e) { player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage("Use: setkills id"); } return true; }

The World (SpawnObject) method:

public static final void spawnObject(WorldObject object, boolean clip) { int regionId = object.getRegionId(); getRegion(regionId).addObject(object); if (clip) { int baseLocalX = object.getX() - ((regionId >> 8) * 64); int baseLocalY = object.getY() - ((regionId & 0xff) * 64); getRegion(regionId).addMapObject(object, baseLocalX, baseLocalY); } synchronized (players) { for (Player p2 : players) { if (p2 == null || !p2.hasStarted() || p2.hasFinished() || !p2.getMapRegionsIds().contains(regionId)) continue; p2.getPackets().sendSpawnedObject(object); } } }

item.title: Boxing Ring
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“masan05, post:5, topic:538252”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=657080.msg4395969#msg4395969 date=1389131988]

I could be completely wrong, but I think a boxing ring is comprised of multiple objects. So you would need to spawn multiple objects to make a boxing ring.

Also, for future reference, you should do a much better job explaining what you need in a server help post. It’s very hard for people to help you when you are as vague as you were.

Sorry, I logged on and did ::object 13129, which is the object id for boxing ring and nothing appears. How would i make it all appear?
If i can’t do it through the game, could you explain how i could code it in with multiple objects?

It could be something to do with the object type. Try changing that.
[/quote]
I’m sorry, I don’t understand?[/quote]
Umm post your object spawn method and I can show you.

Read full topic
